page.title: 12ECOLOGY-Flora
page.content:
The soil is sandy on most areas of the Chase.In these areas heather and gorse are common.In other areas the soil is more fertile.Some common flowers are {Heath Bedstraw.}The plant has white star like flowers.Another is {Creeping Tormentil} with a four petal,yellow flower in Summer to early Autumn.The {Harebell}(blue) and {Ribwort Plantain} also grow here.The {Tissock Sedge} likes the dampness of stream banks and near it is often {Golden Saxifrage}, {Cranberry} and {Cross leaved Heather} {Purple moor grass} is also common in peaty areas. This plant stores food in swollen leaves.
(Charlotte Lewis Age 11
